Jan 15 – Jan 20

The API I used for gathering information

  • pytrends
    • unofficial API of Google Trends makes it easy to gather vast amounts of information from Google search
      • Use keywords I chose when I tried to gather information from Twitter
        • 統一 OR 統一教会 OR 文鮮明 OR 韓鶴子 OR 家庭連合 OR 祝福2世 OR 祝福二世 OR 祝福２世
        • ２世 OR 二世 OR 2世 OR 宗教二世 OR 宗教2世 OR 宗教２世 OR 三世 OR 3世 OR ３世 OR 宗教三世 OR 宗教3世 OR 宗教３世
      • Codes used pytrends are the following:
import pytrends
import matplotlib
import pandas as pd
from matplotlib import pylab as plt
font = {'family' : 'Noto Sans CJK JP'}
matplotlib.rc('font', **font)
import requests
from lxml import etree
from pytrends.request import TrendReq

# API Connection
pytrends = TrendReq(hl='ja=JP', tz=540)
# Set the search keyword
kw_list1 = ['統一教会', '統一協会', '旧統一協会', '旧統一教会']
kw_list2 = ['文鮮明', '韓鶴子', '家庭連合', '祝福二世']
kw_list3 = ['統一', '祝福２世', '祝福2世']

pytrends.build_payload(kw_list1, timeframe='2022-07-07 2023-01-17', geo='JP')
df1 = pytrends.interest_over_time()

pytrends.build_payload(kw_list2, timeframe='2022-07-07 2023-01-17', geo='JP')
df2 = pytrends.interest_over_time()

pytrends.build_payload(kw_list3, timeframe='2022-07-07 2023-01-17', geo='JP')
df3 = pytrends.interest_over_time()

df = pd.concat([df1, df2, df3], axis=1)
df.to_csv("gt-church-20220707-20230117.csv", encoding="shift_jis")

item.content:encoded:
Jan 17

After I graduated from high school, I made an appointment with one professor who are specialized in mind control by “cults” such as Aum or “Unificaiton Church.” He is very kind for me, and he invited me to join one of his classes for graduate students.

It was before the assasination of Shinzo Abe, so I was just one of the rare example of those who have experienced spiritual abuse by parents and luckly Japanese Child Consultation Center (CPS-like organization) decided to took me from my parents. I learned many things from he and his students. How to investigate the impact of spiritual abuse or the existance of research center that focuses on conspiracy theory is the examples.

It is final period in Japan, so he and his students seemed very busy but they were warmly accepted me. One of his student are working on investigating the longer effect of spiritual abuse by surveying former followers of “Unification Church,” Jehovah’s Witnesses, Happy Sciences, and some other new religions in Japan. I briefly reviewed the draft of questionere, and gave some advice in the use of languages.

After that, me and professor talked about current situation. He worried about the decrease of public interest against “Unification Church” and spiritual abuse since currently Japanese government seems they want to stop discussing about this problem more because they made “rescue bill,” which he thinks not enough. But he worked for the guideline for Spiritual and close sorts of Child Abuses by MHLW, and both of us feels it is enough to help children and youths who are suffering.

However, since he is a Social Psychologist, he knows there are few psychologists who can deal with this kind of complex problem. Because of that, he now aims to seek the way to increase the number of psychologists who have basic knowledge about religion and spiritual abuse through their education while trying to increase the number of students who want to be a psychologist.

Finally he said it is very precious that I, who have been experienced spiritual abuse and its after effects while interested in spiritual abuse and advocating individual rights, am studying outside Japan because this studying opportunity will give me new perspective that cannot be gaind from Japan. I don’t know how or if I contribute to this problem so far, but definetly I can work for that in the future.

item.content:encoded:
Jan 15

We met at nearest shopping center of us. She is one of the referee of me when I won scholarship from Japanese foundation, and she have been worked for me since I joined my previous residence after I left my home. We have kept in touch during fall semester, so it is natural for both of us to meet in person.

At the table, we mainly talked about our shared interest: spiritual abuse from the parents. Because of the publication of the guideline for Spiritual and close sorts of Child Abuses by the government, we discussed about that while talking about my curennt academic interest and college life in general. Both of us appriciate the guideline since it will certainly help those who are suffering spiritual abuse, but we worried about the lack of experts who can deal with this irregular types of abuses.

Also while I worried about the politicalization of the argument about “Unification Church” and spiritual abuse, she accepts its politicalization because she believes it is the best and fastest way to rescue those who are suffering.

When it comes to political standpoints of us, I feel I am little bit of conservative left while she seems liberal of liberal. Because of that she is wholeheartedly working for advocating children’s rights. I also wish to expand children’s rights, but I don’t feel current Japanese situation is healthy. It seems like Japanese ruling and opposit parties are depending on one-side information and purging one religious corporation. Despite the “Unification Church” has been decieved many people through spiritual sales and illegal preaching, it is one of the certified religious coporations in Japan and I think I should respect it while enforcing law against its illegal behaviors.

Because of this kind of thought, I decided to read right-wing magazines and seek around what Japanese right-wings are thinking about this problem. When I told this plan for her, she was interested in that and said please teach me when you find something interesting.

It was only dinner, so we couldn’t talk much. But I think I found some interesting different perspective from her. This short but prolific conversation, I decided to focus on the interest for this problem based on right/left wings.

item.content:encoded:
Today I met with my friend, who is studying at International Christian University as a senior. She finally decided to major in Anthropology, but she was also interested in advocation for children. She has worked on Save the Children Japan and advocated for educating the treatment of children’s rights.

We talked about many things, especially those related to our future careers. Because she is a senior, she has been working on job applications while I have just finished my first semester as a college student. But one thing we have in common: the undescribable anxiety for our future. Thus we spent a lot of time on this topic.

Anyway, about spiritual abuse. She seemed to focus more on supporting while the child is in the family and after the child leaves their family. Since I have experienced living in a group home, she talked about the quality of a group home.

My group home is awesome – of course, I am biased. But I heard very bad rumors from other group homes and rarely saw news articles reporting abuse in the group home, which should be a safe place for children.

And she said, “I guess some welfare workers treat children badly because they think of themselves as ‘who are helping the misery child’ to some extent.” I agree with that. However, I do not know how to prevent that kind of person from getting a position in the group home. In Japan, almost any kind of welfare institution is always recruiting workers despite not having enough money to run the group home easily.

My group home, though, have a lot of money and has some lawyers working for children. The founder of the corporation which runs my group home seems very good at finding and gathering the people they need. But not every corporation is like that. Some institutions are suffering from a lack of money. Others are doing everything they can to hire. We concluded we should consider these problems while discussing treating spiritually abused children.

item.content:encoded:
Jan 6 – Jan 9

“Seiron”

産経新聞出版局, サンケイ出版, and 産業経済新聞社. 1973. 正論 産経新聞出版局. https://ci.nii.ac.jp/ncid/AN00370131.

  • 2022 Feb, no articles mentioning this topic
  • 2022 Mar, some articles touched on the concept of “family,” which seems deeply affected by doctrines of the “Unification Church” yet did not mention the term “Unification Church.”
  • no mention of “Unification Church” until 2022 Oct
    • 2022 Oct, mentioned “Unification Church” in some articles
    • One mentioned the relationships between religious corporations and LDP since LDP is currently making a coalition with New Komeito, which has Soka Gakkai (Buddhism New Religious Movement in Japan) as a power base
    • One justified its relationships with the “Unification Church,” arguing how the impact of the church was small for the ruling party, Liberal Democratic Party (LDP)
    • One criticized both right and left wings for this problem while partly praising the “Unification Church” related organizations’ works, primarily related to N. Korea’s kidnapping of the Japanese.

After Oct 2022, we have not discussed “Unification Church” and its related issues.

Akahata (newspaper published by the Japanese Communist Party, JCP)

赤旗編集局, 日本共産党中央委員会機関紙誌業務部, and 日本共産党中央委員会出版局. 2004. しんぶん赤旗. 縮刷版[CD-ROM] ed. 日本共産党中央委員会機関紙誌業務部; 日本共産党中央委員会出版局 (発売). https://ci.nii.ac.jp/ncid/AA11954267.

  • Skim from Oct 2022 to Dec 2022
  • Every once or twice a week, they mentioned “Unification Church” and related columns, such as interviewing former followers of “Unification Church” or Jehovah’s Witnesses, viewpoints from professionals.
  • They worked hard for this problem, but it may be because “Unification Church” has cooperated with LDP, and generally, Akahata newspaper tends to criticize LDP.
Oct 2022
Nov 2022
My reflection on this reading

Left-side newspapers tend to criticize conservatives due to “connection with ‘Unification Church’ related organizations,” however, left-side newspapers often interviewed or introduced “second-generations” perspectives. Personally, those “second generations” should also be aware of making connections with certain political sides; otherwise, they are doing the same thing as the “Unification Church” did.

item.content:encoded:
The “Unification Church” follower sued the local authority because of a “violation of Freedom of Faith”

On December 16, 2022, one man sued Toyama city because the resolution of terminating the relationship with the former “Unification Church” was passed by the Toyama city congress.

The man claimed that Toyama city congressman and congresswoman refused his proposal to bring his petition against this resolution, which violates the right to petition, the fundamental part of democracy.

item.dc:creator: sato

item.content:encoded:
“Requesting Reports and Asking Questions” – Religious Corporations Act Article 78-2

  • Since January 4, “Requesting Reports and Asking Questions” has been attempted twice by Agency for Cultural Affairs under the control of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science, and Technology (MEXT).
  • The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science, and Technology heard the opinions of an advisory council, Religious Corporations Council.
  • “Requesting Reports and Asking Questions” had been added to the article because of terrorism, mainly the Tokyo subway sarin attack, by Aum Shinrikyo but was never attempted until November 22, 2022.
What is the right of “Requesting Reports and Asking Questions” or “questioning right”

This right can be exercised if the one who is in a religious organization continuously violates the law or the organization causes serious damage.
After examining reports, the minister of MEXT can ask for the order of dissolution of the religious organization for the court. When the court finds a cause, it may order the dissolution of the religious corporation.

The contents of reports and questions will not publish for a certain period because of “privacy for both sides.”

First Attempt

The first attempt had excused on November 22, 2022. Based on MEXT, they asked for “Unification Church” to answer about the documents related to the operation of the organization, statements, documents, and accounting books related to their assets.

The agency received the answer for Cultural Affairs on December 9, 2022. However, the Agency said the reports from “Unification Church” were not enough, so they re-attempted the right on December 14, 2022, again.

Second Attempt

Since the first attempt could not gain enough information from the “Unification Church,” the Agency for Cultural Affairs re-attempted to exercise “questioning right” for the church.

References

Religious Corporation Act
news article by Japan Broadcasting Corporation, public media

“旧統一教会に「質問権」 行使は初めて 解散命令に該当か調査へ: NHK.” NHKニュース. Japan Broadcasting Corporation, November 22, 2022. https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20221122/k10013899551000.html.

Trying to correct twitter data

Today I found I can use cloud services to run this program, making the project easier.

However, since Twitter’s problem, I can’t verify my Twitter developer account for the last few days (I’m writing this on Jan 5). So I just read and summarized on current news about “Unification Church” for the next few days.

Updated on Jan 8
Finally, Twitter sent me the verification code, so I ran the code below. However, it said I need Elevated access to run this script, so I am now requesting Elevated API access for Twitter. FAQ and developer forum suggests it usually takes less than a week.

For example, I will run the script below to correct tweets related to “Unification Church.”

gathertw.sh -l ja -o ja --sincedt=20220707 -c -- 統一 OR 統一教会 OR 文鮮明 OR 韓鶴子 OR 家庭連合 OR 祝福2世 OR 祝福二世 OR 祝福２世

item.content:encoded:
Correcting Twitter data as a piece of public opinion

From today, I am going to work on correcting Twitter posts related to “Unification Church” and “Second Generation.”

Based on this project, I will use “Kotoriotoko” to gather Twitter posts. This is open-source software built by Japanese scholars and seems easy to run. However, since I aim to gather two different but overlapping concepts, I need two separate computers that can run this program 24/7. Fortunately, I have one old computer I barely use, so the first one would be that one. For my second computer, I could buy a new small computer for this research using new year’s discounts or borrow an unused computer from a group home.

I could not verify my phone number for a Twitter account, which I want to use, so I am going to get another phone number for this project and a one-month trip to Japan.
